page.title: 01BURTON UPON TRENT (WEST)
page.content: This area of East Staffordshire is predominantly rural with a densely populated urban fringe.Included in the area are eight farms. The villages of Branston and Tatenhill form part of its make-up. These two villages together with the suburban area known as Shobnall fall within the postal area of Burton upon Trent. The main A38 dual-carriageway linking the M1 and the North with the M5-M6 interchange, Birmingham and the South runs through the area, as does the Trent and Mersey Canal. The highest point above sea-level is 107 metres.
